item.title: Expected Release Time for Football Manager 26's Beta
item.description:
After the cancellation of last year's game and the biggest overhaul in the franchise's history, Football Manager 26 is almost here. While the full game will release on all platforms on November 4th, 2025, there is an Advanced Access Beta for those who preorder the game on PC .

You can preorder the game at any time before 4th November and still gain access to the Beta on PC. Preordering is even cheaper on most platforms.

Naturally, veteran players and newcomers to the series are eager to jump into the new match engine and bespoke UI as soon as possible, and thus, everyone is wondering what time the FM 26 Beta will be released .

Expected Release Time For Football Manager 26's Beta

It has been confirmed that the FM 26 Beta will go live on Thursday, 23rd October 2025 , but a specific release time will only be confirmed on that day. However, Sports Interactive did say it would go up in the evening, UK time (BST) .

This narrows down the release window substantially, and it's also possible to look at past release times from previous installments, with the aim of making a solid estimate.

4:00 pm - 6:00 pm BST is a solid bet as this covers all their previous release times. As Sports Interactive is a British dev team, it's unlikely to be any later. FM 24 was released at 4:00 pm , so this would be the most likely, but be prepared to wait a few more hours.

Global Release Times For The FM 26 Beta - Based On 4:00 pm BST Estimate

If the Football Manager 26 Beta is released at 4:00 pm BST, then the following would be the global release times for each time zone .

L.A. - PDT

08:00 - October 23rd

Chicago - CDT

10:00 - October 23rd

New York - EDT

11:00 - October 23rd

Sao Paulo - BRT

12:00 - October 23rd

UTC

15:00 - October 23rd

London - BST

16:00 - October 23rd

Prague - CEST

17:00 - October 23rd

Cape Town - SAST

17:00 - October 23rd

Ankara - EEST

18:00 - October 23rd

Singapore - SGT

23:00 - October 23rd

Tokyo - JST

00:00 - October 24th

Sydney - AEST

02:00 - October 24th

Wellington - NZST

04:00 - October 24th

Take this estimation with a grain of salt and be prepared to wait an hour or two longer in your respective time zone.

Can You Preload The Football Manager 26 Beta?

Unfortunately, players cannot preload the beta for FM 26 , meaning they will face a download when it drops. Thankfully, however, the Steam page predicts that it will only take up 20 GB of storage , meaning downloads shouldn't take too long.

It's unknown at the time of writing whether the full game will have a preload.

Football Manager 26

item.title: The Best Ninja Gaiden Games, Ranked
item.description:
Spanning a good thirty years, the Ninja Gaiden franchise provides high-octane ninja action with the Ultimate Ninja himself, Ryu Hayabusa. He has seen his fair share of hacking and slashing in both 2D and 3D iterations of his games, from the SNES to the more recent Xbox and PlayStation consoles.

But which Ninja Gaiden is the definitive title among its numerous console versions? From frantic side scrollers to unforgiving blade-and-shuriken-riddled platforming and enemy-slicing combat, the franchise is home to some real gems, but some entries are arguably better than others. Let's take a look at the absolute best Ninja Gaiden games from across the decades.

Updated on October 22, 2025 by Mark Sammut: Finally, we have a new 3D Ninja Gaiden game. Ninja Gaiden 4 is out and pretty awesome, but where does it sit among the franchise's greatest games? Does it top Black? Is it better than Ragebound, which came out earlier this year? It might be a bit premature to rank NG4 already, but we can always revisit this topic if multiple playthroughs suggest an alteration is required.

11 Ninja Gaiden 3: The Ancient Ship of Doom

Very Difficult, But Not Too Far Removed From The Quality Of Its Two Predecessors

Ninja Gaiden 3: The Ancient Ship of Doom
Action
Platformer
Systems
Released
August 15, 1991

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Tecmo
Platform(s)
Nintendo Entertainment System, Nintendo 3DS, Wii, Nintendo Wii U, Atari Lynx
6 Images
Powered by

Ninja Gaiden 3: The Ancient Ship of Doom is an excellent third game of the side-scrolling 2D iterations of the franchise. This title is more forgiving compared to the previous two games, but it doesnt mean its not challenging.

Narrative-wise, Ninja Gaiden 3: The Ancient Ship of Doom happens between the events of Ninja Gaiden 1 and Ninja Gaiden 2: The Dark Sword of Chaos . Ryu has to clear his name following the death of Irene. He investigates what Irene was working on in the laboratory and uncovers a bio-weapon that he needs to stop from achieving its goal.

10 Ninja Gaiden 3: Razors Edge

A Competent Improvement On An Underwhelming Game

Ninja Gaiden 3: Razor's Edge
Hack and Slash
Action
Adventure
Systems
Released
November 18, 2012

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Team Ninja
Platform(s)
PC, Nintendo Switch, Nintendo Wii U, PlayStation 3, PlayStation 4, Xbox 360, Xbox One
5 Images
Powered by

Excluding spin-offs and handheld games, Ninja Gaiden 3 is generally regarded as the weakest entry in the series, especially since it was coming off two pretty great games (and their various iterations). Team Ninja was still at the helm, so there was nothing to suggest that the 2012 release would mark such a steep decline in quality. While not amazing, the Razor's Edge edition fixed a few of the base game's issues, including significantly ramping up the difficulty level and incorporating different weapons. If someone is looking to go through everything the IP has to offer, they should go with Ninja Gaiden 3: Razor's Edge and not the vanilla version.

Given that Ryu has close ties with Ayane and the other ninjas from the Dead or Alive games, it was only a matter of time until they got featured in a Ninja Gaiden title. In Ninja Gaiden 3: Razors Edge , players have access to cooperative gameplay and use Ayane in missions. She has her own moveset as well as cutscenes as players progress through the game. This, along with a good number of weapons Ryu has at his disposal, makes for an enjoyable game without straying too far from the challenging notion the franchise is known for.

9 Ninja Gaiden 2: The Dark Sword of Chaos

Ninja Gaiden II: The Dark Sword of Chaos
Action
Platformer
Adventure
Systems
Released
April 6, 1990

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Tecmo
Platform(s)
Nintendo Entertainment System, Arcade, SNES, MS-DOS, Commodore Amiga
6 Images
Powered by

The sequel to the first Ninja Gaiden in NES, Ninja Gaiden 2: The Dark Sword of Chaos continues the frenetic platforming action of the previous game while pushing Ryu Hayabusa into another story that puts his ninjutsu to the ultimate test.

Movement and combat-wise, Ninja Gaiden 2 introduces the ability for Ryu to scale walls using Up or Down on the directional pad and the use of Phantom Doubles to mimic Ryus last action. These are essential skills that Ryu needs to take on the dangers hes set to face. While not shaking up the formula too greatly from its predecessor, the sequel revisits the core formula well, providing another solid action-platform experience that captures that early Nintendo Difficulty.

8 Ninja Gaiden 2 (And Sigma)

Team Ninja's Confident Sequel Is Nearly As Good As Its Highly-Regarded Predecessor

Ninja Gaiden II
9.3 /10
Released
June 3, 2008

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Team Ninja
Platform(s)
Xbox 360
6 Images
Powered by

The second title released by Team Ninja, Ninja Gaiden 2 ramps up the intensity by having even more outrageous enemies and situations in place for players to overcome. This includes troopers wielding rocket launchers and beasts that deal massive damage with their swiping attacks.

Aside from seemingly insurmountable enemies, Ninja Gaiden 2 and Sigma 2 also give players some offensive options by granting them several weapons to lay waste to beasts and soldiers. This adds more variety to combat and gives players more opportunities to unleash cool combos. The sequel is not generally as highly regarded as Ninja Gaiden Black , but it is still among the best hack-and-slash games of the 2000s.

7 Ninja Gaiden (2004)

The Start Of A New Era That Was Eventually Overshadowed By Two Revamped Versions

Ninja Gaiden
Hack and Slash
Action
Adventure
Systems
Released
March 2, 2004
ESRB
M For Mature 17+
Developer(s)
Team Ninja

Platform(s)
Xbox (Original)
4 Images
Powered by

The first game of the franchise to jump from 2D to 3D, 2004s Ninja Gaiden saw Ryu Hayabusa perform his daring feats of ninjutsu using the then-powerful Xbox engine. This resulted in amazing graphics for the time that gave justice to just how formidable Ryu is as the Ultimate Ninja.

Along with the amazing graphics, Ninja Gaiden also brought the difficulty of its predecessors to this generation of gamers. Controls were as tight as they could be for their time, and their deep combat mechanics demanded that players master them if they wanted to finish the game.

6 Ninja Gaiden 2 Black

An Unexpected Surprise That Looks Great And Plays Beautifully

Ninja Gaiden 2 Black
9.3 /10
Released
January 23, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Koei Tecmo Games Co., Ltd.
Platform(s)
Xbox Series X|S, PlayStation 5, PC
6 Images
Powered by

There is n't much separating Ninja Gaiden 2 , Sigma 2 , and Black , at least in terms of quality. That said, the 2025 iteration seems likely to be the preferred choice for most people to experience this story, especially since it is readily available on Game Pass (along with the Master Collection 's Sigma 2 ). Ninja Gaiden 2 Black 's biggest and most obvious asset is the utilization of Unreal Engine 5, which delivers a massive jump forward in visuals. Just to be clear, the original version and especially Sigma 2 still look great considering their age; however, they cannot compete with the remake's modern technology.

Beyond that, 2 Black serves as something of a "complete" version of the 2008 original, one that offers four playable characters (like Sigma 2 ) and the introduction of an easy mode to help newcomers. A post-release update even added New Game+ and a Photo Mode. More importantly, the gameplay is still as tight and furious as ever.

5 Ninja Gaiden (NES)

The One That Started It All

Ninja Gaiden
Action
Platformer
Systems
Released
March, 1989

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Tecmo, Hudson Soft
Platform(s)
Nintendo Entertainment System, Nintendo 3DS, PC, SNES, TurboGrafx-16, Wii, Nintendo Wii U, Switch
6 Images
Powered by

As far as original games are concerned, the NES version of Ninja Gaiden is the best and the most notoriously difficult 2D side-scroller of the franchise. To complete it, players need to clear six Acts that comprise twenty levels, each littered with enemies and projectiles that can knock Ryu off and send him falling to his death. Ryu has to rely on timing his jumps and attacking enemies at the right moment to ensure he doesnt get hit and has enough health to take on the bosses who have devastating attacks of their own.

The original Ninja Gaiden was brilliant for its era, delivering combat that relied far more on skill and technique than was typical. However, it is still a product of its time, and revisiting it can be difficult if somebody is not particularly familiar with action-platformers from the NES era. For many folks, the series really started with 2004's Ninja Gaiden , and everything that came before is ancient history that should be respected but not necessarily experienced.

4 Ninja Gaiden 4

Hopefully, The Start Of A New Era For Ninja Gaiden

Ninja Gaiden 4
9 /10
9.0 /10
Released
October 21, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Platinum Games, Team Ninja, Koei Tecmo Games Co., Ltd.
Platform(s)
PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, PC
Powered by

Ninja Gaiden 4 is finally here. After a string of poor games, the franchise and Team Ninja seemed to need to take a break, and the latter ended up becoming enamored with Soulslikes. Consequently, it started to seem as if Ninja Gaiden was done and might never return; fortunately, those fears proved to be unfounded, and Ninja Gaiden 4 more than lives up to the legendary legacy crafted by NGB and NG2 . Rather than taking on sole responsibility, Team Ninja opted to collaborate with PlatinumGames, a fusion that unsurprisingly results in some of the best combat to ever grace any game of any genre.

For die-hard fans who worried that PlatinumGames' involvement might mark a sharp turn towards a different type of hack and slash combat, rest assured that this game retains the standard Ninja Gaiden formula. The action is intense and rewards efficiency above everything else, challenging players to take down enemies with precision and intelligence rather than relying on endless combos. The core system is very similar to the original 3D games, albeit with a fun twist via "forms" that alter a weapon's moveset.

NG4 is, ultimately, all about its gameplay. Nearly everything else, from the story to the new protagonist (Yakumo), is nothing to write home about, but these shortcomings do not matter all that much in the grand scheme of things.

3 Ninja Gaiden Sigma

Ramps Up The Action And Adds A Touch Of Color, Resulting In A Worthy PS3 Alternative

Ninja Gaiden Sigma
Hack and Slash
Systems
Released
July 3, 2007

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Team Ninja
Platform(s)
PS3
5 Images
Powered by

Ninja Gaiden Sigma is built upon the foundation of 2004's original 3D title, and it differs considerably from both that release and Ninja Gaiden Black . The developers had more room to improve the games graphics and gameplay mechanics, thanks to the PlayStations engine. This allowed for more detailed areas and additional save points and shops.

As for combat, Ninja Gaiden Sigma allowed players to use Ryus bow and arrow while in mid-air, while also permitting him to fight in water. It also gave players access to a wide array of weapons that each had strengths and weaknesses. Players could even power up Ryu's Ninpo powers by shaking the Sixaxis controller.

2 Ninja Gaiden: Ragebound

A Throwback That Is More Than Just A Loving Tribute To The Original Trilogy

Ninja Gaiden: Ragebound
9 /10
8.3 /10
Released
July 31, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
The Game Kitchen
Platform(s)
PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Xbox One, Nintendo Switch, PC
Powered by

While Ninja Gaiden 2 Black was a nice surprise, Ragebound marked the franchise's real full-blown return as the first completely original game in nearly a decade. Due to the pending arrival of its bigger brother, Ninja Gaiden 4 , Ragebound did not quite get the attention that it deserved, but it is a brilliant representative of a specific type of gameplay. Similar to NG4 , Team Ninja turned to another developer to handle this 2D outing, and they wisely went with the team behind Blasphemous . The Game Kitchen knows how to combine intense action and fair difficulty, and this release showcases the developer's talents while also being arguably their most accessible game.

Unlike the 3D outings, Ragebound is not particularly considered with weapons that have wide movesets, but rather opts to challenge players to master a few tools to make quick work of most encounters. While not universal, enemies generally go down in a single hit, so the goal is to efficiently take out foes and thin the herd before you become overwhelmed. The combat is a fantastic evolution of the original trilogy that also incorporates some elements from later games, like powerful arts or charging aura.

The story is silly fun and introduces two new protagonists, Kenji and Kumori. The former is Ryu's stand-in, while the latter is a Black Spider Clan member who ends up fusing with Kenji.

item.title: Xbox Game Pass New Games for November 2025 Wish List
item.description:
October has been a rollercoaster month for Xbox Game Pass . The month kicked off with the news that Microsoft was hiking the price of Xbox Game Pass Ultimate by a whopping 50%, causing an understandable surge of panic through the Xbox community. But even with that dramatic price increase in mind, it's hard to deny that Xbox Game Pass has had a stellar line-up this month, with day-one titles like Ball x Pit , Keeper , and Ninja Gaiden 4 all hitting the service last week, and games like PowerWash Simulator 2 and The Outer Worlds 2 on their way in the coming days.

Following on from such a turbulent month, expectations for Xbox Game Pass' November 2025 line-up are high. There are currently six games confirmed for Xbox Game Pass in November: 1000xRESIST , Football Manager 26 , Whiskerwood , Voidtrain , Winter Burrow , and Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 . Of course, Black Ops 7 is the heavy hitter for next month's Game Pass line-up, but it could use a few more additions to bolster it.

Xbox Game Pass November 2025 Wish List: Tekken 8

Read Game Rant's Review of Tekken 8

  • Released in January 2024
  • Developed by Bandai Namco and Arika
  • Usual retail price: $59.99
  • 32 fighters included in Tekken 8 's base roster
  • 8 game modes including a full story mode, arcade, online, practice, and Tekken Ball
  • Features crossplay between Xbox, PlayStation, and PC
  • OpenCritic Top Critic Average score: 90

The fighting game genre has been enjoying something of a renaissance in the last few years, and Tekken 8 is one of the movement's key players. Released at the start of last year, Tekken 8 received universal acclaim from critics and fans alike due to its stellar visuals, crunchy fighting mechanics, and the depth of its content. Over the last year and a half, Tekken 8 has only gotten better, with a total of 8 characters having been added to the game via DLC.

Fighting games are a bit of a rarity on Xbox Game Pass, with the only standouts right now being Mortal Kombat 11 and Injustice 2 . Adding Tekken 8 to Xbox Game Pass' November 2025 line-up would be a major boon not just for fans of the series, but for the subscription service as a whole.

18
8.4 /10
9 /10

Tekken 8

t

Xbox Game Pass November 2025 Wish List: Cyberpunk 2077

Read Game Rant's Review of Cyberpunk 2077

  • Released in February 2022
  • Developed by CD Projekt Red
  • Usual retail price: $59.99
  • Main story takes around 25 hours to finish
  • 100% completion takes around 100 hours
  • OpenCritic Top Critic Average score: 76

A redemption story for the ages, Cyberpunk 2077 was met with widespread disdain when it released back in 2022. Though its PC port was widely regarded as a fine RPG experience, Cyberpunk 's Xbox and PlayStation versions were lambasted for their poor technical performance.

Flash forward three years and Cyberpunk 2077 has become one of the most acclaimed action-RPGs of all time. Along with an onslaught of updates that have practically fixed all of the game's technical issues, developer CD Projekt Red has spent the last three years tweaking Cyberpunk 's mechanics to near-perfection and adding a wealth of new content to the game. Cyberpunk 2077 is one of the most highly-requested Xbox Game Pass additions, with or without its lauded Phantom Liberty expansion.

124
8.9 /10
6 /10

Cyberpunk 2077

Xbox Game Pass November 2025 Wish List: Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2

Read Game Rant's Review of Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2

  • Released in September 2024
  • Developed by Saber Interactive
  • Usual retail price: $69.99
  • Features a full campaign, an Operations co-op mode, and an Eternal War PvP mode
  • Six customizable multiplayer classes to choose from and upgrade
  • Continues the story of Space Marine 's ex-Ultramine Captain Titus
  • OpenCritic Top Critic Average score: 81

Xbox Game Pass is already home to a surprising number of Warhammer 40,000 games. Rogue Trader , Darktide , and Space Marine - Master Crafted Edition are all available on Xbox Game Pass, all offering distinct experiences in the grimdark far-future universe of Warhammer 40,000 . But there's one 40K game that's sorely missing from Xbox Game Pass' library.

Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2 was one of the biggest surprises of 2024, delivering a long-awaited sequel that not only managed to stick the landing for long-time fans, but also reach an audience outside of the die-hard 40K fanbase. Space Marine 2 offers visceral melee combat, gory visuals, and a wealth of co-op and PvP modes for friends to enjoy together, making it the perfect candidate for Xbox Game Pass in November 2025.

Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2 was such a runaway success that a sequel is already confirmed to be in development.

34
9.1 /10
9 /10

Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine II

Xbox Game Pass November 2025 Wish List: Thank Goodness You're Here

Read Game Rant's Review of Thank Goodness You're Here

  • Released in August 2024
  • Developed by Coal Supper
  • Usual retail price (on PlayStation): $19.99
  • Can be beaten in just 23 hours
  • Comedy-focused game inspired by The Mighty Boosh and Monty Python
  • OpenCritic Top Critic Average score: 85

A quintessentially British game, Thank Goodness You're Here may not have been officially recognized at last year's Game Awards, but it's undoubtedly one of the most unique indie games of 2024. Thank Goodness You're Here is a laugh-a-minute interactive comedy hidden behind the facade of a simple side-scrolling adventure-puzzle game, and it's a must-play for anyone who's ever enjoyed the likes of Monty Python , The Mighty Boosh , and Shooting Stars .

Despite releasing last August for PlayStation, PC, and even Nintendo Switch, Thank Goodness You're Here still hasn't found its way to Xbox consoles. It'd be great to see it finally come to Xbox, and a day-one launch on Xbox Game Pass could give it the second wind it deserves.
